Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of bearded and bald man, possibly a teacher or philosopher. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating and paint. Red-brown Nile silt with grey core and abundant mica.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Teacher and pupil groups are not commonly represented at Naukratis (see Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.2.1909; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4715), though are elsewhere in the Early Hellenistic world (British Museum GR 1896,1021.4 ).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.291) (Phase 3)
